page.title: 06APPEARENCE OF CHURCH
page.content: The earliest church was probably a wattle hut(made of mud) in existence before the Norman conquest but it had no churchyard. In 1099 a church was built for the convinence of the local land owner and his tenants so that they might have a burial place. Over the years extra sections were added to the church.The tower was built about the year 1220 and has a unique lean-to recess.In the late 13th century the church was considerably enlarged probably to cater for an increased population employed in distilling salt from the sea. What the church looks like. The church looks very old with worn stone work and with a square Norman tower.The tower has a clock face and there is a flag and a weather vain.
